result.execSummary:
The defendant Laurie Kay Sherock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laurie Kay Sherock is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laurie Kay Sherock was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250.00 fine inclusive of all costs by 10/5/2015 or 30 days in HOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laurie Kay Sherock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
As to the amended Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
As to Count 2:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State, Court dismissed the count.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Alice S.
Court orders defendant pay a $250.00 fine inclusive of all costs by 10/5/2015 or 30 days in the HOC.
Filed:  Letters of support.

Defendant Laurie Kay Sherock in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court amends Count 1 to a misdemeanor charge of battery under Wis. Stats. 940.19(1) a Class A misdemeanor.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Laurie Kay Sherock in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Laurie Kay Sherock in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Padurean contacted the Court to ask to reschedule the arraignment set for 5/5/15 due an unexpected scheduling conflict.  Without objection of the Court, arraignment rescheduled for 4/27/15 at 1:30 in Branch 22. Defense stated they would contact the Defendant.  State notified of scheduling change.

Defendant Laurie Kay Sherock in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Arraignment is scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/8/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Alice S. or Dennis B.

Defendant Laurie Kay Sherock in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Laurie Kay Sherock in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defense counsel entered not guilty plea to count 2. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
